posts.name: Bocce Club Pizza
posts.note: Mainstay for traditional, specialty and gluten-free pies plus wings behind a villa-style exterior. Their sausage pizza is still one of my favorites and their pepperoni isn't bad either. NOTE: Takeout only place.

posts.name: Chefs Restaurant
posts.note: Destination for hearty Italian comfort food and desserts welcoming families and friends since 1923. The dish to get there is the Spaghetti Parmesan which is a deep plate with spaghetti covered in sauce and enough Parmesan cheese for over four normal orders. If you order more than a medium you should plan on taking half of it home for another meal it's that big.

posts.name: Duff's Famous Wings
posts.note: Established restaurant is known for its chicken wings and drumsticks coated in spicy house sauce. If you ask locals about chicken wings, they will recommend Duffs. When my family gets together, we order 50 or 100 wings extra crispy with sauce on the side and a few order of fries and gravy. We found with my parents living three miles away it's best to mix the sauce in once we get them home to keep the wings crispy on the outside.

posts.name: Ted's Charbroiled Hot Dogs
posts.note: Long-running chain known for charcoal-grilled hot dogs and other fast fare since 1927. In a perfect world you order two charbroiled hot dogs with mustard, onion, and pickle relish along with an order of French fires and a chocolate milkhsake to dip the fries in.
